alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 7:26AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Road conditions expected to quickly deteriorate across east central and southeast Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas, including the Interstate 49 corridor... A strong Arctic cold front will sweep through east central and southeast Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas through 10 am, with areas of freezing rain immediately following the front. With temperatures rapidly falling into the teens, roads may flash freeze, creating slick and dangerous driving conditions. Winds gusting to around 45 mph can also be expected, making travel more difficult. The freezing rain will likely transition to light snow later this morning. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Roads can freeze over quickly as temperatures plummet behind the Arctic cold front. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245-1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
